page.title: 05LLANSTEFFAN AREA: BEHAVIOUR
page.content: Llansteffan and Llanybri villages are only 2 miles apart and are one parish so they have been closely linked. There is traditionally a slight antagonism - "the posh people live in Llansteffan and the servants came from Llanybri" is quoted. Nevertheless there are within and between both communities strong bonds of neighbourliness. We all know one another and many are interrelated. Nobody in distress of any sort need feel alone or neglected. Newcomers to the area are soon integrated. Of course quarrels and disagreements occur, but politics, religion, language, the usual bones of contention, arouse no strong passions here. This doesn't mean that a bland indifference prevails. Welsh people are generally volatile and lively-minded; we are no exception.
